sen.j: 安土桃山時代に豊臣秀吉が太閤堤をはじめとする淀川の治水事業を行い、宇治川と濠川（ごうかわ、ほりかわ）を結ぶ形で港が設けられ、三十石船が伏見と大阪の間を行き来した。
sen.e: In Azuchimomoyama Period, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI led river improvement projects of Yodo-gawa River including building Taiko-zutsumi Dike and ports which linked Uji-gawa River and Go-kawa (Hori-kawa) River, and Sanjukkoku-bune (literally, thirty-koku Ships, which were old Japanese commercial ships) operated between Fushimi and Osaka.

In the Azuchimomoyama Period, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI led river improvement projects on the Yodo-gawa River including building Taiko-zutsumi Dike and ports which linked Uji-gawa River and Go-kawa (Hori-kawa) River, and Sanjukkoku-bune (literally, thirty-koku Ships, which were old Japanese commercial ships) operated between Fushimi and Osaka.

In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI led river improvement projects on the Yodo-gawa River including building Taiko-zutsumi Dike and ports which linked the Uji-gawa River and the Go-kawa (Hori-kawa) River, and Sanjukkoku-bune (literally, thirty-koku Ships, which were old Japanese commercial ships) operated between Fushimi and Osaka.

sen.j: 江戸時代には角倉了以・角倉素庵父子が高瀬川を開削し、京都の中心部と伏見が結ばれることとなりさらに便利になった。
sen.e: In Edo Period, Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA cut Takase-gawa River wider, and that linked Fushimi and the center of Kyoto improving transportation further.

sen.j: 幕府の伝馬所も置かれ、参勤交代の大名が立ち寄るために本陣や大名屋敷も置かれていた。
sen.e: At Fushimi-ko Port, there were tenmajo (post station) of Bakufu (Tokugawa Shogunate), honjin (hostel for government officials to stop and stay), and daimyo houses in which daimyo (samurai lords) stayed on their trips for Sankin Kotai (system of alternate attendance to Edo) duties.

sen.j: 幕末期には坂本龍馬が伏見港の船宿である寺田屋を常宿としていたのは有名である。
sen.e: It is well known that Ryoma SAKAMOTO often stayed at Teradaya, an inn at the port, in the end of Edo Period.

sen.j: 明治に入り琵琶湖疏水（鴨川運河）が開通すると疏水とも接続、大津市から大阪までの水上交通が完成し蒸気船が運航された。
sen.e: In Meiji Period, Biwako (Lade Biwa) Sosui (Kamo-gawa Canal) was opened to traffic to be connected with Fushimi-ko Port completing the water traffic system with operations of steamboats.
In the Meiji Period, the Biwako Lake Sosui (Kamo-gawa Canal) was opened to traffic to connect Fushimi-ko Port, completing the water traffic system with operations of steamboats.

sen.j: また、日本初の電車である京都電気鉄道（後の京都市電）が伏見港と京都市内を結ぶために建設された。
sen.e: Japan's first operation of electric railcars, Koto Electric Railway (later, Kyoto Municipal Streetcar), was established to connect Fushimi-ko Port and Kyoto City.

sen.e: In 1929, Mitsukomon (a water gate) was built because the dikes of Uji-gawa River were repaired to make difference in water level between Uji-gawa River and Go-kawa River.

sen.j: その後、鉄道や道路輸送が発達し水運は衰えたため1967年、跡地を埋め立てて公園とする都市計画が決定され廃港となった。
sen.e: In the years after that, the water transportation declined with development of railways and road transportation, so in 1967, it was decided to abolish Fushimi-ko Port along with the new city plan that would reclaim land for a park from the port.
